{{Distinguish|Rave Un2 the Joy Fantastic}} {{Infobox album | Name = Rave In2 the Joy Fantastic | Type = [[Remix album]] | Longtype = | Artist = [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] | Cover = Prince_Rave_In2.jpg | Border = yes | Alt = | Released = April 29, 2001 | Recorded = 1998â1999 | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Rock music|rock]], [[funk]] | Length = 64:09 | Label = [[NPG Records|NPG]] | Producer = [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] | Reviews = | Last album = ''[[Rave Un2 the Joy Fantastic]]''
(1999) | This album = '''''Rave In2 the Joy Fantastic'''''
(2001) | Next album = ''[[The Very Best of Prince]]''
(2001) | Misc = }} '''''Rave In2 the Joy Fantastic''''' is a [[remix album]] by [[Prince (musician)|Prince]] (his stage name at that time being an unpronounceable symbol), released via mail exclusively through the [[NPG Music Club]], an Internet subscription service, on April 29, 2001.{{Cite web| last = Moss| first = Corey | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Prince Offers Fans Exclusive Material Via Online Club| work = MTV.com| publisher = | date = February 9, 2001| url = http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1439259/20010209/prince.jhtml| format = | doi = | accessdate = }} The album is an alternative version of ''[[Rave Un2 the Joy Fantastic]]'', released the previous year. The album makes a number of alterations to its predecessor. One track ("Rave In2 the Joy Fantastic") is a brand new version, with altered lyrics and a faster tempo. Four "Undisputed (The Moneyappolis Mix)", "[[The Greatest Romance Ever Sold]]", "Hot Wit U (Nasty Girl Remix)" and "Man'O'War (Remix)") have been remixed or had substantial musical elements added or removed. Three tracks ("Tangerine", "Baby Knows" and "Prettyman") are mostly unchanged, save for slightly longer tag endings, or extended jams at the end. Five are unchanged ("So Far, So Pleased", "I Love U, but I Don't Trust U Anymore", "Silly Game", "Whatever U Do, Wherever U Go", "The Sun, the Moon and Stars"). Lastly, two tracks, "Strange but True" and "[[Everyday Is a Winding Road]]", have been removed and replaced by the moody "Beautiful Strange", a previously unreleased track written in 1998. As it was released via the fan-centric NPG Music Club, the album received virtually no attention from wider media. However, with several improved songs, the removal of two weaker tracks, and the addition of "Beautiful Strange", one of the album's highlights, fans generally consider ''Rave In2 The Joy Fantastic'' to be superior to its predecessor. ==Track listing{{Cite web| last = | first = | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Track listing| work = Discogs| publisher = | date = | url = http://www.discogs.com/Artist-Formerly-Known-As-Prince-Rave-In2-The-Joy-Fantastic/release/643154| format = | doi = | accessdate = }}== # "Rave In2 the Joy Fantastic" â 5:13 # "Undisputed" (The Moneyopolis Mix) â 5:45 # "[[The Greatest Romance Ever Sold]]" (Extended Remix) â 8:07 # "Hot Wit U" (Nasty Girl Remix) â 4:22 # "Tangerine" (Extended Version) â 2:13 # "So Far, So Pleased" â 3:23 # "The Sun, the Moon and Stars" â 5:15 # "Man'O'War" (Remix) â 5:12 # "Baby Knows" (Extended Version) â 3:52 # "I Love U, but I Don't Trust U Anymore" â 3:33 # "Beautiful Strange" â 4:55 # "Silly Game" â 3:29 # "Wherever U Go, Whatever U Do" â 3:15 # "Prettyman" (Extended Version) â 5:35 ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Prince}} [[Category:2001 remix albums]] [[Category:Prince (musician) albums]] [[Category:Prince (musician) compilation albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Prince (musician)]] [[Category:NPG Records remix albums]] [[Category:English-language remix albums]]
